newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street stocks seen opening lower.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street stocks seen opening lower.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to head lower with bonds at the start of trading on Thursday after the Dow tumbled almost 140 points on Wednesday.
Analysts blame the decline on the bond market and the fact that the long bond yield is again inching higher. They expected to see further weakness at Thursday's start.

"We are up 830 points in less than a month. The laws of gravity come into effect," said Larry Wachtel, analyst at Prudential Securities. "Bonds are the gatekeeper for stocks. When yields fall, stocks are up. Now yields are rising again."
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 139.67 points on Wednesday to close at 7,085.65.
